TN is also seeing a rise in overdoses. According to the @CDCgov, overdoses fell nationwide in 2018, but TN is seeing more overdose deaths than ever before.  https://bit.ly/2Y1fLca  pic.twitter.com/UXl8spjZ0N

And although in more recent years the number of opioid prescriptions has decreased nationally, according to the @NIDAnews, TN still has the 3rd highest opioid prescribing rate in the country - 1.5x greater than the national average.
In Dickson County 58.3 pills were being distributed person per year.
In Davidson County 49.1 pills were being distributed per person per year.
In Cheatham County 43.2 pills were being distributed per person per year.
From 2006-2012 Tennessee was 4th in the US in the number of opioid pills distributed per person, per year.
